name: Thea
Relationship: Antidote: KALI-HYPO PHOS.; THUJA.; FERR.; KALI-HYD. (Material doses for tea-taster's cough.)
Modalities: Worse: on walking in open air

Heart: Palpitation; unable to lie on left side
Head: Hallucinations of hearing
Sleepless and restless
Temporary mental exaltation
Sick headache radiating from one point
Ill-humored
Cold damp feeling at back of head
Stomach: Sudden production of wind in large quantities
Sleep: Sleepy in daytime; sleepiness at night, with vascular excitement and restlessness, and dry skin

details: Nervous sleeplessness, heart troubles, palpitation, and dyspepsia of old tea-drinkers. Produces most of the sick headaches Tabacum antidotal (Allen).
dosage: Theine 1/4-1/2 grain hypodermicallyThird to thirtieth potency.
